description: Returns the current state of the given simulation.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the simulation. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time when the simulation was created, expressed as the number of seconds and milliseconds in UTC since the Unix epoch (0:0:0.000, January 1, 1970).

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the simulation.

nested_items.name: ExecutionId
nested_items.description: A universally unique identifier (UUID) for this simulation.

nested_items.name: LiveSimulationState
nested_items.description: A collection of additional state information, such as domain and clock configuration.

nested_items.name: Clocks
nested_items.description: A list of simulation clocks.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the simulation clock.

nested_items.name: TargetStatus
nested_items.description: The desired status of the simulation clock.

nested_items.name: Domains
nested_items.description: A list of domains for the simulation. For more information about domains, see Key concepts: Domains in the SimSpace Weaver User Guide.

nested_items.name: Lifecycle
nested_items.description: The type of lifecycle management for apps in the domain. Indicates whether apps in this domain are managed (SimSpace Weaver starts and stops the apps) or unmanaged (you must start and stop the apps).
PerWorker --- Managed: SimSpace Weaver starts one app on each worker.
BySpatialSubdivision --- Managed: SimSpace Weaver starts one app for each spatial partition.
ByRequest --- Unmanaged: You use the StartApp API to start the apps and use the StopApp API to stop the apps.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the domain.

nested_items.name: LoggingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Settings that control how SimSpace Weaver handles your simulation log data.

nested_items.name: Destinations
nested_items.description: A list of the locations where SimSpace Weaver sends simulation log data.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogsLogGroup
nested_items.description: An Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group that stores simulation log data. For more information about log groups, see Working with log groups and log streams in the Amazon CloudWatch Logs User Guide.

nested_items.name: LogGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group for the simulation. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference. For more information about log groups, see Working with log groups and log streams in the Amazon CloudWatch Logs User Guide.

nested_items.name: MaximumDuration
nested_items.description: The maximum running time of the simulation, specified as a number of minutes (m or M), hours (h or H), or days (d or D). The simulation stops when it reaches this limit. The maximum value is 14D, or its equivalent in the other units. The default value is 14D. A value equivalent to 0 makes the simulation immediately transition to Stopping as soon as it reaches Started.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the simulation.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that the simulation assumes to perform actions. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference. For more information about IAM roles, see IAM roles in the Identity and Access Management User Guide.

nested_items.name: SchemaError
nested_items.description: An error message that SimSpace Weaver returns only if there is a problem with the simulation schema.

nested_items.name: SchemaS3Location
nested_items.description: The location of the simulation schema in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3). For more information about Amazon S3, see the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information about buckets, see Creating, configuring, and working with Amazon S3 buckets in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: ObjectKey
nested_items.description: The key name of an object in Amazon S3. For more information about Amazon S3 objects and object keys, see Uploading, downloading, and working with objects in Amazon S3 in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: SnapshotS3Location
nested_items.description: A location in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) where SimSpace Weaver stores simulation data, such as your app .zip files and schema file. For more information about Amazon S3, see the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information about buckets, see Creating, configuring, and working with Amazon S3 buckets in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: ObjectKey
nested_items.description: The key name of an object in Amazon S3. For more information about Amazon S3 objects and object keys, see Uploading, downloading, and working with objects in Amazon S3 in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: StartError
nested_items.description: An error message that SimSpace Weaver returns only if a problem occurs when the simulation is in the STARTING state.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current lifecycle state of the simulation.

nested_items.name: TargetStatus
nested_items.description: The desired lifecycle state of the simulation.
